FacilityName: Central Montana Co-op Aqua Plant - Denton
ParentCompanyName: Central Montana Co-op ( Denton ) Main Office

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
The management and employees of Central Montana Co-op - Denton are committed to the prevention of any accidental releases of Aqua ammonia. If an accidental release should occur, Central Montana Co-op is perpared to work with the local fire department, or other authorities, to mitigate ant release and minimize the impact of the release to the people and the environment.

The primary activity at Central Montana Co-op is the storage and blending of fertilizers for sale to farmers.

Aquq ammonia is blended, stored and distributed for both direct application and for fertilizer for crop production nutrients.

The maximum quantity stored would be 60,000 pounds in our storage tanks. The maximum quantity handled would be the loading of a delivery truck holding 50,000 pounds.

The worst-case release scenario would be the release of the total contents of our storage tank released as a liquid over 74.5 minutes. The maximum quantity release would be 60,000 pounds, which represents the volume of the storage tank. The distance to the endpoint is.3698 miles.

The alternative release scenario would be the failure of a liquid spill which would release 2000 pounds over 43.2 minutes. The distance to endpoint would be .0774 miles.

Central Montana Co-op has implenmented the provions of "Safety Requirements of the Storage and Handling of Amhydrous Ammonia, K-61.1", published by The American Standards Institute, Inc., and the standards of the U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration ( OSHA ), 29 CER 1910.111,"Storage and Handling of Anhydrous Ammonia.

There have been no accidental release of Aqua Ammonia in the past five years that have caused any deaths, injuries or significant property damage at the facility; nor to our knowledge, have resulted in offsite deaths, injuries, evacuation, sheltering in place, property damage or environmental damage.

Central Montana Co-op's emergency response program is provided to the state and county under the emergency planning and community r

ight-to-know information as required under SARA Title III (EPCRA).

Safety improvement is an on-going process at Central Montana Co-op. Periodic evaluations are performed to assess the maintenance of safe conditions. There are no additional specific anhydrous ammonia safety recommendations for implementation at this time.
